snippet: Chesapeake Energy announced that it would replace Aubrey K. McClendon as chairman and end his controversial compensation plan.
abstract: Chesapeake Energy announces that it will replace Aubrey K McClendon as chairman and end his controversial compensation plan that grants him the right to buy a 2.5 percent stake in every well the company drills; McClendon, who built Chesapeake into the nation's second-largest producer of natural gas, will remain as chief executive; board will seek to appoint a nonexecutive chairman with no ties to the company.

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and MICHAEL J. de la MERCED
byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston and Michael J. de la Merced from New York.

lead_paragraph: Chesapeake Energy announced that it would replace Aubrey K. McClendon as chairman and end his controversial compensation plan.

headline.seo: Chesapeake to Replace McClendon as Chairman
